channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-15137] CallTimeoutException and CallQueueTooBigException should trigger PFFE
item.description: If a region server is backed up enough that lots of calls are timing out then we should think about treating a server as failing.
item.summary: CallTimeoutException and CallQueueTooBigException should trigger PFFE

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.

comments.comment: Not sure this is 100% correct, it's a starting place though.

-1 overall

I'm not sure we want to temper with couldNotCommunicate to server flag, as it's used to clear up failuresMap and I don't think that's what we want? Also there's unused (always false) property on PFFE to report whether operation failed on client only or not.

This message was automatically generated.
checkstyle complained because I aligned my changes with existing codestyle (misformatted)
Probably needs a rebase with the re-working of exceptions.

Added handling for CQTBE and relevant checks for RetriesWithDetailsExceptions, which is tricky to unwrap, added a test.

Added a flag to PFFE class indication whether or not operations is guaranteed to not be attempted by server (for example, CQTBE does guarantee that, but CallTimeoutException does not)
